Question_1.Context: Soil salinization can have adverse effects on seed germination, growth, flowering, and fruiting of plants due to salt stress.
Question_1.Question: What is a consequence of soil salinization on plants?
Question_1.C: Adverse effects on seed germination and growth
Question_1.Source: However, plants cannot grow up normally in the soil with high salt content due to the occurrence of salt stress exerting adverse effects on seed germination, growth, flowering, and fruiting.

Question_2.Context: Brassinolide (BR) is a plant hormone that can regulate various growth stages and enhance plant tolerance against environmental stresses, including salt stress.
Question_2.Question: What role does brassinolide (BR) play in plant development?
Question_2.B: It acts as a broad-spectrum plant growth regulator
Question_2.C: It decreases plant tolerance to environmental stresses
Question_2.D: It is only involved in the flowering stage
Question_2.Source: Among brassinosteroid derivatives and conjugates, BR possesses the most biological activity, and generally regarded as an efficient, broad-spectrum, and non-toxic plant growth regulator, regulating seed germination, flowering and other growth stages, playing important role in the growth and development of plants.

Question_3.Context: Mesoporous silica nanoparticles (MSN) have been used in agriculture as nanocarriers to protect pesticides and enhance their efficacy.
Question_3.Question: What is one of the applications of mesoporous silica nanoparticles (MSN) in agriculture?
Question_3.Source: Of note, MSN has been widely utilized in agricultural field as a nanocarrier to protect pesticides from photodegration and prolong pest control.

Question_4.Context: The synthesis of mesoporous silica nanoparticles (MSN) involves the hydrolysis and condensation of a silica source under certain conditions.
Question_4.Question: What is involved in the synthesis process of mesoporous silica nanoparticles (MSN)?
Question_4.B: Hydrolysis and condensation of tetraethyl orthosilicate
Question_4.D: Deposition of silicon from silane gases
Question_4.Source: The nanocarrier was synthesized via the hydrolysis and condensation of tetraethyl orthosilicate (TEOS) under alkaline condition using cetyl trimethyl ammonium bromide (CTAB) as a template.

Question_5.Context: The loading of a substance into mesoporous silica nanoparticles can be confirmed by various characterization techniques, including Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy.
Question_5.Question: Which characterization technique can confirm the loading of a substance into mesoporous silica nanoparticles?
Question_5.Source: The successful preparation of BR@MSN was confirmed by Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) and thermogravimetric (TG) characterizations.

Question_6.Context: The thermal stability of a compound can be analyzed by observing the temperature at which the compound begins to decompose.
Question_6.Question: What does the thermal stability analysis of a compound typically involve?
Question_6.Source: In the case of BR@MSN, an obvious weight loss peak was found at 428 ℃, which was mainly attributed to the decomposition of BR in BR@MSN.

Question_7.Context: The sustained release behavior of a compound from a carrier can be described by various kinetic models, which help to understand the release mechanism.
Question_7.Question: Which kinetic model might describe the sustained release behavior of a compound from a carrier?
Question_7.Source: According to the regression coefficient (R2) values of the kinetic fitting curves, the sustained release behaviors of BR from BR@MSN followed the first-order model.

Question_8.Context: Superoxide dismutase (SOD) is an enzyme that plays a crucial role in protecting cells from oxidative damage by converting superoxide radicals into less harmful molecules.
Question_8.Question: What is the function of superoxide dismutase (SOD) in plants?
Question_8.B: Converts superoxide radicals into less harmful molecules
Question_8.Source: In addition, after the foliar application of BR@MSN, SOD activity increased by 234.11%, MDA content decreased by 61.30%, and chlorophyll content increased by 110.88%, which further confirmed the improvement of cucumber seedlings against salt stress.

Question_9.Context: Malondialdehyde (MDA) is a biomarker for oxidative stress in plants, indicating the level of lipid peroxidation in cell membranes.
Question_9.Question: What does an increased content of malondialdehyde (MDA) in plants indicate?
Question_9.Source: As a product of membrane lipid peroxidation, MDA content is highly relevant with the growth status of plants and thus utilized to evaluate the level of salt stress.

Question_10.Context: Chlorophyll content in plants is an important indicator of their health and photosynthetic efficiency, which can be affected by environmental stresses.
Question_10.Question: What does chlorophyll content in plants generally indicate?
Question_10.Source: In addition, the foliar application of BR@MSN brought about the increase in chlorophyll contents. Total chlorophyll content is the sum of chlorophyll a content and chlorophyll b content.
